citation.article-title: Virgibacillus byunsanensis sp. nov., isolated from a marine solar saltern
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Virgibacillus byunsanensis sp. nov.
Virgibacillus byunsanensis (byun.san.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. byunsanensis of Byunsan, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-variable and rod-shaped (0.2–0.4×1.0–5.0 μm).
A few cells longer than 10.0 μm may occur.
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Terminal spherical or oval endospores are observed in swollen sporangia.
Colonies on 6 % NaCl MA are circular, slightly convex, glistening, smooth, yellowish-white in colour and 0.7–1.0 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at 4 and 40 °C, but not at 45 °C.
Growth occurs at pH 6.0, but not at pH 5.5 (optimum between pH 7.0 and 8.0).
Growth occurs with 0–20 % NaCl, but not with more than 21 % NaCl [optimum 8 % (w/v) NaCl].
Anaerobic growth does not occur on 6 % NaCl MA or on 6 % NaCl MA supplemented with nitrate.
Mg2+ ions are required for growth.
Oxidase-positive.
Starch is hydrolysed, but hypoxanthine, xanthine, tyrosine and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are not.
Acid is produced weakly from d-ribose, but is not produced from l-arabinose, cellobiose, lactose, maltose, melezitose, raffinose, sucrose, d-xylose, myo-inositol or d-sorbitol.

Susceptible to ampicillin, carbenicillin, cephalothin, chloramphenicol, lincomycin, novobiocin, oleandomycin, penicillin G, streptomycin and tetracycline and weakly susceptible to gentamicin, kanamycin and polymyxin B, but not to neomycin.

In assays with the API ZYM system, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8) and leucine arylamidase are weakly present, but lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α- and β-galactosidases, β-glucuronidase, α- and β-glucosidases, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are absent.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid as the diamino acid.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
The predominant fatty acid is anteiso-C15 : 0.
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1 and Supplementary Table S1.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 37.6 mol% (determined by HPLC).
The type strain, ISL-24T (=KCTC 13259T =CCUG 56754T), was isolated from a marine solar saltern of the Yellow Sea, Korea.
